title: jerry0
author: jerry0
content: I use an iphone.  Years ago I remember using blockfolio as the app on the iphone where it would showed updated cryptocurrency prices and you could add the ones you want as favorites to check them.  You could also enter what price and how much you bought or sold specific coins.  A while later, when I went to update the app, it became FTX? However the app hasn't worked in a while.  I remember I would set alerts on the blockfolio app such as if a certain coin hits a certain price and there would be an alert.  Which iphone app is good for that now that blockfolio doesn't work anymore?  I want one where you can check altcoins and not only bitcoin.  Also where you could enter transactions such as you bought or sold x amount of coin at x price on so and so date like blockfolio.  Back then it was the best app right?  But now which is it?

comments.author: jerry0
comments.body: So what is the best app similar to blockfolio from back then?

comments.author: Andrija Branislav
comments.body: We know that the features available in the application are indeed useful and make it easier for us to make timely investment decisions, but now many have appeared. Well, you need to pay attention that not everyone has the same type of cellphone as you.In addition, if it is not updated again, it will look like in the case of switching from Blockfolio to FTX and it will be very vulnerable to hacking or unauthorized access.

comments.author: slashz9
comments.body: You can try gecko coins and marketcap coins, but I use gecko coins more often, and I always get notifications if a coin experiences a drastic increase/decrease, and you can mark your favorite coins.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: jerry0 on December 07, 2023, 09:09:49 PMWhich iphone app is good for that now that blockfolio doesn't work anymore?  I want one where you can check altcoins and not only bitcoin.  Also where you could enter transactions such as you bought or sold x amount of coin at x price on so and so date like blockfolio.  Back then it was the best app right?  But now which is it?I'm not sure about price alerts, but if it's about being able to set a portfolio based on buying and selling at a certain time, the Coinmarketcap app could be your choice now.Apart from its basic use as a crypto tracker, Coinmarketcap also has other advantages, namely the existence of a special community for various existing crypto projects, which makes you more updated and can focus more on knowing the latest developments on certain projects.

comments.author: Publictalk792
comments.body: It look like you really liked using Blockfolio before. but now it do not work for you anymore. I can understand that you just want to find another app that will do similar things like blockfolio which were giving services like checking different types of cryptocurrencies giving alerts when prices changing and keep track of your transactions. One app you may try CoinStats. It work on Apple phones and have much features like showing the current prices of different cryptocurrencies. You can set alerts for price changes and can help you to track of your transactions. It also work with altcoins so you can keep an eye on your favorite coins. I will say you should check this application this will give a good experience or even better experience as compare to Blockfolio.

Because, as far as I know, this app is not also browser-friendly. Now, when it comes to the portfolio you are talking about, I am not familiar with that either. But I seem to have seen that in Facebook ads.  Then there are many other options for price alerts about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency; there are crypto.com, Coingecko, coinmarketcap, and Gecko Terminal on the Dex platforms.

comments.author: icalical
comments.body: I have been using the Coinmarketcap iOS app, and it has been great, my favorite feature is the Watchlist widget where you can pick some of your favorite cryptos then you just one swipe away to keep up to date to your favorite crypto price. Other good feature is the portfolio features, tho it's not as good as Blockfolio back then but it's still great, the cons only that you can put your portfolio on widget too, I wish they can add this on the widget in the future.

comments.body: Unfortunately I'm not a big fan of the Apple phone, I prefer the Samsung, you can download Coingecko or CoinMarketcap, can you upload the application in the Appstore?because I usually use these 2 applications.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: Not an iphone user but I have heard of good things about coinmarketcap and coingeckoCoinmarketcap also allows you to track your portfolio and analyze market movements another app that i hear a lot of people recommending is coinbase Be careful in choosing apps or platforms to handle your assets in it is better to use well established apps instead of new ones you want an app that has good functions and at the same time secure enough to handle your coins and not be at risk of system hacks

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: You should be able to set up price alerts on most big exchanges, I know you can with Kraken so I assume the likes of Binance & Coinbase will facilitate this too. An extensive iPhone app that tracks a large variety of coins that’s sleek & easy to use is Coinmarketcap. Others have mentioned it but I’d like to comment & back it top, it’s my favourite non-exchange tool to check the price of lots of coins.
